Class InputNeuron

java.lang.Object
net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.LinearModel
net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.LinearCombination
net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.NeuronFunction
net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.Neuron
net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.InputNeuron
All Implemented Interfaces:
EstimationFunction, ScalarEstimationFunction, TrainableScalarFunction, TrainableFunction
@DomainObject public class InputNeuron extends Neuron
Represents an input neuron in a neural network.

Unlike hidden or output neurons, an InputNeuron does not compute its output from weighted inputs and an activation function. Instead, its output value is set directly from outside the network (e.g., by feeding in features of a training or inference sample).

Behavior

  • setInputValue(float) assigns the fixed output value for this input neuron and marks it as activated.
  • Neuron.activate() does not perform any computation; it merely verifies that the neuron has been given an input value, otherwise it throws an IllegalStateException.
  • Neuron.deactivate() (inherited) clears the activation flag so a new input can be assigned in a subsequent pass.

Usage example


 InputNeuron n1 = new InputNeuron("x1");
 InputNeuron n2 = new InputNeuron("x2");

 n1.setInputValue(0.5f);
 n2.setInputValue(-1.2f);

 // these are now ready to be consumed by downstream neurons
 float v1 = n1.getOutput(); // 0.5
 float v2 = n2.getOutput(); // -1.2

Input neurons are typically the entry points of a network, one per feature dimension in the dataset.
